title: ID a sanserif font with strange "t"
content:
Hi everyone!

Below is an excerpt of a word cloud. I’d like to ID the font used in it: the sanserif type with that strange lowercase “t”. Thanks for the help!

[Click here to see the image.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122102103/http:/img142.imageshack.us/img142/7468/47222648mv1.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Untitled-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122102103/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_38.jpg) | 180.85 KB |

 [‹ Strong Properties serif ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122102103/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48754 "Go to previous forum topic") [Web font have a clue but not sure ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122102103/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48750 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fathairyape

comments.content:
Isn’t there some fairly current incarnation of Helvetica that really only differs in that it has these funky ts? A friend of mine had it...I’ll research.

Though this is Chalet.
So I was sort of wrong in both ways, but on the right track. Yay!
